title: Reforming Nuclear Reactor Testing at the Department of Energy

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the Department of Energy to speed up the testing and deployment of advanced nuclear reactors, including establishing new pilot programs outside national labs and streamlining environmental reviews. Its goal is to foster innovation in nuclear technology to support domestic energy production and maintain U.S. leadership in this important field.
potential_concerns: Expediting reviews and approvals might reduce thorough environmental and safety oversight, potentially increasing risks of accidents or environmental harm.
Prioritizing certain reactors for rapid deployment could disadvantage smaller or less well-funded developers, limiting competition and innovation diversity.
Establishing pilot programs outside national laboratories may face challenges in oversight and maintaining stringent safety and security standards.
The ambitious timeline to achieve criticality in approved reactors may be difficult to meet, risking delays or unmet expectations.
Streamlining NEPA compliance could provoke criticism from environmental groups and lead to legal challenges that could delay projects.
